revised_title: Evolution of Cretaceous Asteroidea: A Study of Fossil Starfish
tldr: This article examines the evolution of Cretaceous Asteroidea, a group of fossil starfish, by studying their isolated ossicles found in chalk deposits. The author traces the lineage of these starfish through different zones and localities, providing insights into their morphology, ornamentation, and environmental influences. The study also discusses the classification and nomenclature of these species, as well as the significance of their fossil record for understanding the history of life on Earth.
